dt: {bc}any of various prickly composite plants (especially genera {it}Carduus, Cirsium{/it}, and {it}Onopordum{/it}) with often showy heads of mostly tubular flowers

et: Middle English {it}thistel{/it}, from Old English; akin to Old High German {it}distill{/it} thistle
shortdef: any of various prickly composite plants (especially genera Carduus, Cirsium, and Onopordum) with often showy heads of mostly tubular flowers; also : any of various other prickly plants

dt: {bc}a biennial Eurasian thistle ({it}Cirsium vulgare{/it}) with purplish flower heads and prickly leaves that is naturalized as a weed in the U.S.

shortdef: a biennial Eurasian thistle (Cirsium vulgare) with purplish flower heads and prickly leaves that is naturalized as a weed in the U.S.

dt: {bc}a European thistle ({it}Cirsium arvense{/it}) with pinkish-purple or white flowers naturalized as a weed in North America

shortdef: a European thistle (Cirsium arvense) with pinkish-purple or white flowers naturalized as a weed in North America

dt: {bc}any of a genus ({it}Echinops{/it}) of widely cultivated Asian and Mediterranean composite herbs with spiky globose blue or white flowers

shortdef: any of a genus (Echinops) of widely cultivated Asian and Mediterranean composite herbs with spiky globose blue or white flowers

dt: {bc}a tall thistle ({it}Silybum marianum{/it}) having white-veined dark green leaves and large purple flower heads that is native to the Mediterranean region but has become naturalized elsewhere including the U.S.
{bc}an extract of milk thistle and especially its seeds that is held to protect the liver from damage or disease

shortdef: a tall thistle (Silybum marianum) having white-veined dark green leaves and large purple flower heads that is native to the Mediterranean region but has become naturalized elsewhere including the U.S.; also : an extract of milk thistle and especially its seeds that is held to protect the liver from damage or disease

dt: {bc}a Eurasian thistle ({it}Carduus nutans{/it}) that has nodding musky flower heads and is naturalized in eastern North America

shortdef: a Eurasian thistle (Carduus nutans) that has nodding musky flower heads and is naturalized in eastern North America

dt: {bc}any of a genus ({it}Sonchus{/it}) of spiny weedy Eurasian and African composite herbs including some (such as {it}S. arvensis{/it} and {it}S. oleraceus{/it}) widely naturalized in North America

shortdef: any of a genus (Sonchus) of spiny weedy Eurasian and African composite herbs including some (such as S. arvensis and S. oleraceus) widely naturalized in North America

dt: {bc}a widely naturalized spiny Old World knapweed ({it}Centaurea calcitrapa{/it}) with purple flowers
{bc}any of various knapweeds related to the star thistle

shortdef: a widely naturalized spiny Old World knapweed (Centaurea calcitrapa) with purple flowers —called also caltrops
any of various knapweeds related to the star thistle
